channel.title: Infivate Special
channel.description: Hey, I wanted to know how to make a weapon have unlimited special. Is there a way? Or tell me the code.

item.title: Infivate Special
item.dc:creator: @Leecher_Ian Leecher Ian
item.description:
@Leecher_Ian wrote:

look for public void calculateSpecial() {

ill use dlong for exemple

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1305 && specialAmount <= 0) { // d long specialDamage = 0; specialDamage2 = 0; sendMessage("You do not have enough special energy left."); } if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1305 && specialAmount >= 0) { // d long startAnimation(451); specialDamage = 18 + misc.random(5); specialAmount -= 50; }

in those u wud change at 0
if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1305 && specialAmount >= 0) { // d

or just makee if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 746 && specialAmount >= 0) { // d skim startAnimation(451); specialDamage = 40 + misc.random(5); specialAmount -= 100; }

Read full topic

item.title: Infivate Special
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

[quote=“LeScape, post:5, topic:195468”]Whatever the integer is that stands for your special amount, search for that, it might be something like:

specAmount;

Or…

specialAmount;

Then where it says something like:

intName -= #; //intName being the integer above, # being the number of the integer lost.

You would change # to 0.[/quote]

or just quote out that line so then it will stop trying to take away 0 every time

Read full topic

item.title: Infivate Special
item.dc:creator: @letspkemscape letspkemscape
item.description:
@letspkemscape wrote:

to make unlimited spec search in your client.java and search && specialAmount now find that and you will see a number beside it. now put in 1 (1 means unlimited) make sure the weapon that you made have unlimited spec make sure you change all the (&& specialAmount) thing

           hope this helps :D

letspkemscape

Read full topic

item.title: Infivate Special
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

Whatever the integer is that stands for your special amount, search for that, it might be something like:

specAmount;

Or…

specialAmount;

Then where it says something like:

intName -= #; //intName being the integer above, # being the number of the integer lost.

You would change # to 0.

Read full topic
